posts.name:
Josh Braun
Josh Braun
posts.content:
People love to glamorize the solopreneur life.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre your own boss!‚Äù
‚ÄúWork on your terms!‚Äù

Sounds harmonious, doesn‚Äôt it?

But the path isn‚Äôt always clear skies.
It‚Äôs not always balanced.

You are everything.
The creator, the seller, the marketer, the keeper of the books.
No one else carries the load.

Some days, it feels like the weight of the world.
Wins come, and so does the quiet.

You learn to move with the flow,
to accept the unpredictable,
to embrace that both winning and quiet months are part of the same experience.

Being a solopreneur isn‚Äôt about control.
It‚Äôs about surrendering control.
It‚Äôs about adapting.

It‚Äôs messy.
It‚Äôs uncertain.
It‚Äôs solitary at times.

But it‚Äôs also yours.

If you‚Äôre dreaming of this path, remember:
It‚Äôs not an escape from work.
It‚Äôs a job of finding joy in the journey.

comments.commentText: well said! the highs and lows come together‚Äîit‚Äôs a ride of constant adaptation
Naaaaah. It's pretty awesome. ::shrugs:: I also outsource all that crap I don't want to do. And for free, my personal assistant is simply the Fut.io app/apple reminders/IFTTT or Zapier/

India's space startup,, is set to launch three of its six hyperspectral imaging satellites aboard a SpaceX rocket from California.

has confirmed that the company has no plans to downsize its Indian operations amid global job layoffs.

Raises INR 150 Cr Debt, Eyes EBITDA Profitability In FY25.

Opens New Centre In Lucknow, Shares Jump 5%.

Likely To File Draft Papers For INR 3K Cr IPO By March End.

EV StartupBags INR 161 Cr From Bharat Value Fund.

On Track To Double Production Of Smartphones & Laptops In FY25.

posts.name:
Nuwpur Jain
Nuwpur Jain
posts.content:
My dadi died 7 days back BUT she lived an absolutely full life which shocks me even today

Here's what made her extraordinary:

1) The Family Matriarch: She nurtured an incredible legacy of 51 hearts - 6 children, 18 grandchildren, and 27 great-grandchildren. Each one carrying a piece of her boundless love.

2) The Eternal Explorer: At 80+, she had the curiosity of a 21-year-old, traveling from Singapore to Dubai, and finally to Ram Mandir - living life with more enthusiasm than people a quarter her age.

3) The Graceful Goodbye: Seven days ago, she left us exactly how she lived - peacefully, having fulfilled all her wishes, and without suffering. A perfect ending to a life lived perfectly.

Here's to you, Dadi - forever young, forever loved Ô∏è

comments.commentText: Nuwpur, your tribute to your grandmother beautifully captures the essence of a remarkable life well-lived. Her legacy of love and curiosity is truly inspiring and serves as a reminder of how to embrace life fully, regardless of age. Thank you for sharing such heartfelt memories.
Priyank Ahuja Living proof that the best things in life come without an expiry date

posts.name:
Jenn Drummond
Jenn Drummond
posts.content:
Want to shine on the big stage? Start in the shadows.

‚Üí The early blog posts nobody reads.
‚Üí The open mic night that no one attends.
‚Üí The office party where you‚Äôre the only one dancing.

They don‚Äôt feel big.

They don‚Äôt feel like wins.

But they‚Äôre ùò∏ùò©ùò¶ùò≥ùò¶ ùò™ùòµ ùò¥ùòµùò¢ùò≥ùòµùò¥.

Early attempts aren‚Äôt a failure.

They‚Äôre training and they:

- build your skills,
- teach you resilience,
- prepare you for big stages.

So, ignore the applause for now.

Instead, train.

Practice your speech in an empty room.
Try recording and posting a video on LinkedIn.
And attend that open mic night with 'no audience.'

Because low stakes prepare you for high stakes.

Focus on showing up, learning, and doing the reps.

P.S. What‚Äôs your ‚Äúlow stakes‚Äù practice? Let‚Äôs talk.

comments.commentText: Start shining behind the scenes.
Florin Andronic Exactly!  It's where you refine your craft and build the foundation for bigger moments ahead.
Jenn Drummond 100%
You nailed it Jenn Drummond
Bret Packard Appreciate it!

posts.name:
Adam P. Boyd
Adam P. Boyd
posts.content:
"Train the managers first."

That's what I told a CEO who wanted me to jump straight into sales team training.

He pushed back.

"We don't have time. The team needs help now."

Six months later, he pulled me aside:

"You were right. Since we got the managers up to speed first:

Pipeline accuracy improved 40%
Forecast reliability jumped to 85%
Team actually follows our sales process"

 Do you know why it worked?

Because when managers understand how to coach and support their teams, everything else falls into place.

They:

Reinforce the training daily
Catch issues early
Keep the team accountable.

I help mid-market companies develop sales teams that consistently hit targets through practical, results driven training.

Starting with management.

That's what we're doing in our sales management boot camp. Should you invest in your managers?

comments.commentText: So important to train the sales managers first Adam - not sales training but sales management training - so that they can also coach to your sales training content.

Dave Kurlan Like I learned from someone good - most managers weren't coached themselves - they had to figure it out on their own. 

Can you imagine baseball managers or football coaches who hadn't been coached formally taking the reins of a team?

Not only can I imagine that scenario Adam, I saw it first-hand during the 5 years of little league where Dad coaches not only hadn't been formally coached themselves, many of them hadn't played and didn't know how the game should be played. Embarrassing! Yet, that's what you and I often see in sales organizations - sales managers who haven't been properly coached and, in too many cases, sales managers who haven't previously sold! Shameful.
100%! Managers are the foundation - the more you invest in them, the stronger the team. Gotta play the long game

posts.name:
Mark Stubbs
Mark Stubbs
posts.content:
Boo! Meet the EV Charging GHOST! 

Now I thought I‚Äôd seen everything in our Ô∏èindustry with the hours I spend studying it but, alas, today I was introduced to something I have never seen before and, quite frankly, it looks pretty awesome!

have created a Flattening-Charging solution for electric vehicles! 

Traditional round cables can be tedious, bulky, and hazardous in major cites, a challenge for many urban and suburban environments.

This flat-corded charger is engineered to lay flat, reducing tripping risks and providing a sleek, space-saving solution, rolling up for storage. Whether you're charging at home or on the go, the design offers an alternative EV charging solution that can be safer and more convenient than ever.

The GHOST flat cable is weather-resistant, preventing freezing and stiffening in cold temperatures which makes it unique in their current ability to perform under the toughest conditions.

With the capability to deliver up to 40A and 9.6kW, Ghost provides up to 30 miles of charge per hour.

In Europe and China, their 50A model delivers up to 48 miles per hour, ensuring fast and efficient charging for all EVs. Plus they offer a mode three cable.

Plus, the charger‚Äôs low profile meets ADA requirements, making it safe for pedestrians and still offering high performance.

They are also working on a retractable wall charger, and later on an inductive charging pad featuring their flat cable technology.

Clearly they are well positioned to provide a flexible, reliable solution for city dwellers, suburban homeowners, and businesses.

Nice work/ David Sirieix

comments.commentText: interesting. how does it stick to the floor to stay flat? EVinfo.net
Hi Bill Pierce, try this: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/ghostallaccess_evchargingrevolution-roundlessbyghost-crowdfundingpower-activity-7270221523381108736-7bfI?

Bill Pierce Especially below freezing. Thawing and freezing, and consistent temperatures (below freezing) are a topic unfortunately are a daily hindrance where I live.
Another popular topic/idea is ADAS. Great concept, but sliding on ice is a fact no matter what you drive. I make points of these concepts not because of critism, but reality. I'm an above average driver with many vehicles, but it's a talent in these conditions and IMO, still has a long way to go.
There is absolutely (that I'm aware of) ADAS can control a condition when control is no longer possible and the algorithms technology are essentially useless.
It's taken me years of practice and understanding of RWD and FWD concepts. Even still, the best drivers still are at the mercy of mother nature.
Myself included.

Is it IP67 rated (and isolated electricially from H2O on it's insertion port)? Americans, especially, have a tendency to plug, play, unplug and forget. It will end up laying on the ground. 
The effort (and/or) time it takes to properly return it to it's station is too much for some owners. Not to mention running it over.
Thankfully, we learned to replace the gas pump handle in the dispenser.

Just saying...
Hi Kristopher Koudelka the effort will be determined by how keen the owner is to make that transition to a personal mobility that does not poison others I guess

I appreciate your succinct agreement, Dhvani. It often takes a shared perspective to highlight the importance of aligning our professional narratives effectively on LinkedIn. Your insights are always valuable.
